sentence.Network_en: She leaned over the balustrade and shouted to the man downstairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 她俯身在阳台栏杆上对楼下的人们喊着.

sentence.Network_en: So we lay on the roof under the balustrade.
sentence.Network_cn: 于是我们就躺在屋顶的栏杆下面.

sentence.Network_en: Put the raincoat on the balustrade to drain.
sentence.Network_cn: 把雨衣放在栏杆上去滴干.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French, from balustre (see baluster)

entry.tran: （阳台或楼梯的）栏杆，扶手，护墙
entry.def: A balustrade is a railing or wall on a balcony or staircase.

means.word_mean: 1. a railing at the side of a staircase or balcony to prevent people from falling

auth_sentence.content: One of those centralized courtyards...enclosed on three sides by the house and on the fourth by a balustrade.

auth_sentence.content: Opening the windows, Vivien leaned her arms on the wrought-iron balustrade, looking out into the night like a heroine in a film.

auth_sentence.content: Standing on a balustrade outside City Hall, he addressed some five hundred thousand protesters.
